summary: This is an email from Nicholas Biase, Public Affairs Officer for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, inquiring about the procedural step of dismissing an indictment in the Epstein case, specifically asking if it would be a nolle prosequi. It reflects internal DOJ communication regarding case management shortly after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: Author of an internal DOJ email inquiring about the procedural dismissal of an indictment, likely in relation to the Epstein case following his death.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Internal DOJ email discusses dismissing an indictment, likely related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The email is dated August 10, 2019, shortly after Epstein's death in custody on August 9-10, 2019.
The inquiry asks if dismissing the indictment would technically be a 'nolle' (nolle prosequi), indicating procedural considerations post-defendant's death.
